title: Synthetic Recap
body:
MIAMI — On a night when the hardwood floor felt more like a canvas, Allan Houston delivered a masterpiece for the ages. In a crucible of playoff pressure, the New York Knicks’ guard erupted for a staggering 41 points, single-handedly out-dueling the entire Miami Heat in a heart-stopping 100-99 victory.

From the opening tip, this was Houston’s symphony. He sliced through the Miami defense with an effortless grace, his mid-range jumper a metronome of perfection. Every time the Heat threatened to build momentum, there was Houston, silencing the raucous road crowd with another silky-smooth bucket. He was unstoppable, a force of nature in a Knicks uniform, pouring in points from every conceivable angle.

The final moments were a chaotic scramble befitting a playoff war. With the score impossibly tight, the Knicks needed one final stop. They got it, as the Heat’s last-gasp attempt rattled out, sealing a one-point triumph for New York. But this victory had one name written all over it.

While teammates like Patrick Ewing provided crucial support, this night belonged exclusively to Houston. His 41-point explosion was not just a stat line; it was a declaration. In a game defined by grit and defensive struggle, Houston’s offensive clinic was a breathtaking anomaly. He didn't just lead the Knicks to a win; he carried them, securing a pivotal road victory and etching his performance into the rich lore of the NBA playoffs.
